snippet: The author of this week’s cover article explains what it was like to ask an advertising agency to make broccoli “cool.”
abstract: The author of this week’s cover article explains what it was like to ask an advertising agency to make broccoli “cool.”
lead_paragraph: Michael Moss, a Pulitzer Prize-winning investigative reporter for The Times, wrote an article for this week’s health issue about creating an effective marketing campaign for broccoli. His last article for the magazine, about the processed-food industry, was adapted from his book, “Salt Sugar Fat: How the Food Giants Hooked Us.”

headline.main: Behind the Cover Story: Michael Moss on Getting People to Eat Their Vegetables
